content:
Sure, there are many online resources that offer exercises and tips to help you improve your singing technique. Here are some of them:

1. YouTube: YouTube has a wealth of vocal coaches, professional singers, and music educators who offer free vocal exercises, tutorials, tips, and song covers. You can find channels like Singing Success, Eric Arceneaux, Ken Tamplin Vocal Academy, and The Voice Club.

2. Singwise: Singwise is a website that provides free singing lessons, instructional videos, vocal health tips, and resources on voice science and pedagogy.

3. Vocalist.org.uk: Vocalist.org.uk is a comprehensive resource for singers of all levels that offers lessons, exercises, and articles on vocal technique, performance skills, and career development.

4. Musicnotes.com: Musicnotes.com offers vocal sheet music, backing tracks, and other resources to help you practice singing songs in a variety of genres and styles.

5. Smule: Smule is a social media app that features a karaoke-style experience, allowing you to sing along with popular songs and practice your singing skills.

Remember, while these resources can be helpful, it's still important to seek feedback and guidance from a professional vocal coach who can evaluate your voice and offer personalized advice on how to improve your technique.
